issue.title: Improve handling of the `Async thunk failed` error shown when sending asset with transfer lock
issue.body:
The TAHO asset was configured on a contract level on testnet to not allow for transfers between the accounts (with an exception of sending from `testertesting.eth`).

When trying to send TAHO from non-`testertesting.eth` account, the transaction doesn't go through (the tx confirmation screen isn't shown, user is directed to token details view) and no information is shown to user explaining what went wrong. In logs, user can see:
```
logger.ts:208 Async thunk failed {code: 4001, message: 'The user rejected the request.'}
```

We should handle such case better - show some information to user what has happened.

issue.title: `transaction.chainId/signature.v mismatch` error when signing transactions using Ledger
issue.body:
I did some tests of staking in the Subscape dapp (I used the stage-live deployment) on Ethereum Sepolia and although some staking transactions were successful, some failed with the following errors in the wallet logs:
```
logger.ts:208 Error encountered! ledgerID: LEDGER_NANO_S_0x43866d77672dd19252e8ea2274ecece9c62d3262 transactionRequest: [object Object] error: Error: transaction.chainId/signature.v mismatch (argument="signature", value={"r":"0x2b069505b96a272c34d3820efdec59442b4424d4362bec7af2e368150df6a9c3","s":"0x4efc2c085a3688549d2ede91647168de8dbdd45434ab602fcefcaf69c906aaf6","v":843518}, code=INVALID_ARGUMENT, version=transactions/5.7.0)
```
and
```
Error signing transaction Error: transaction.chainId/signature.v mismatch (argument="signature", value={"r":"0x2b069505b96a272c34d3820efdec59442b4424d4362bec7af2e368150df6a9c3","s":"0x4efc2c085a3688549d2ede91647168de8dbdd45434ab602fcefcaf69c906aaf6","v":843518}, code=INVALID_ARGUMENT, version=transactions/5.7.0)
    at Logger.makeError (index.js:224:23)
    at Logger.throwError (index.js:233:20)
    at Logger.throwArgumentError (index.js:236:21)
    at _serialize (index.js:204:20)
    at serialize (index.js:221:16)
    at index.ts:415:35
```
and
```
ProviderBridgeService.routeContentScriptRPCRequest
Error processing request
```

I used version `0.50.0c1e7552` of the wallet and used Ledger Nano S with Ethereum app (`1.10.1`) for signing.

Here are the tests that I did:
TEST 1. Stake 2 TAHO. Staking failed with a different error (`Transfer amount exceeds spender allowance`) - not in scope of this issue
TEST 2. Stake 2 TAHO. Both transactions successful
TEST 3. Stake 3 TAHO. `Token approval` successful, `Contract interaction` failed with `transaction.chainId/signature.v mismatch`
TEST 4. Stake 3 TAHO. `Contract interaction` failed with `transaction.chainId/signature.v mismatch`
TEST 5. Stake 3 TAHO. `Contract interaction` successful
TEST 6: Stake 1 TAHO. Both transactions successful
TEST 7: Stake 2 TAHO. Approve asset spend successful, Contract interaction failed with `transaction.chainId/signature.v mismatch`
TEST 8: Stake 2 TAHO. Contract interaction failed with `transaction.chainId/signature.v mismatch`
TEST 9: Stake 2 TAHO. Contract interaction failed with `transaction.chainId/signature.v mismatch`
TEST 10: Stake 2 TAHO. Contract interaction failed with `transaction.chainId/signature.v mismatch`
TEST 11: Stake 2 TAHO. Contract interaction failed with `transaction.chainId/signature.v mismatch`
TEST 12: Stake 2 TAHO. Contract interaction failed with `transaction.chainId/signature.v mismatch`

Video covering tests 6-12:

https://github.com/tahowallet/extension/assets/78352137/c299681f-74b5-4ce4-ba4f-09b7552a8e5c

Looking at the results, there's no clear rule about which transactions fail and which are successful.

I wonder if the problem may be caused by similar issue as discussed here: https://github.com/ethers-io/ext-signer-ledger/issues/6#issuecomment-1646196739. In this issue, bumping ledger libraries in `ether.js` (https://github.com/ethers-io/ethers.js/pull/1370/files) has helped. But we already use higher versions than those...

pull_request.title: Unsettled Networks: Clear an origin's current network when revoking dApp permissions
pull_request.body:
Draft until I fill in some testing details.

The actual implementation is a little more subtle: permissions are for an origin AND a network. If the permission being cleared is for the origin's current network, as tracked in the `InternalEthereumProvider`, then that current network is cleared so that future interactions can set it.

Latest build: [extension-builds-3616](https://github.com/tahowallet/extension/suites/15762123848/artifacts/899755021) (as of Sat, 02 Sep 2023 20:14:11 GMT).

issue.title: Error estimating gas limit: on in-wallet Sends and on Staking Transactions
issue.body:
I had three accounts in my wallet:
* `0x6e80164ea60673d64d5d6228beb684a1274bb017` (`testertesting.eth`) - imported via PK
* `0x919dba12b6155e75e64b01dd29c77bb2d52fe6b7` and `0xc3185134abea0cdf6eca3ae7adbb1e7c08375b20` - imported from the same recovery phrase

When sending some TAHO from `testertesting.eth` to the two other accounts, the transactions were successfull, but there was this error in logs:
```
Error estimating gas limit:  Error: insufficient funds for intrinsic transaction cost [ See: https://links.ethers.org/v5-errors-INSUFFICIENT_FUNDS ] (error={"code":3}, method="estimateGas", transaction={"from":"0x6e80164ea60673D64d5d6228beb684a1274Bb017","gasLimit":{"type":"BigNumber","hex":"0x06bf7e"},"gasPrice":{"type":"BigNumber","hex":"0x068e7780"},"to":"0xE808174921a73df31756ca0996C1a9E5D9667876","data":"0xa9059cbb000000000000000000000000c3185134abea0cdf6eca3ae7adbb1e7c08375b200000000000000000000000000000000000000000000000006f05b59d3b200000","type":0,"accessList":null}, code=INSUFFICIENT_FUNDS, version=providers/5.7.2)
    at _ethersproject_logger_lib_esm_Logger.makeError (index.js:224:23)
    at _ethersproject_logger_lib_esm_Logger.throwError (index.js:233:20)
    at checkError (json-rpc-provider.js:95:16)
    at SerialFallbackProvider.<anonymous> (json-rpc-provider.js:577:24)
    at Generator.throw (<anonymous>)
    at rejected (json-rpc-provider.js:6:55)
```
Then when I tried to send TAHO from `0x919dba12b6155e75e64b01dd29c77bb2d52fe6b7` to `0xc3185134abea0cdf6eca3ae7adbb1e7c08375b20` - the tx confirmation page didn't show up, in logs there was the following error:
```
logger.ts:208 Async thunk failed {code: 4001, message: 'The user rejected the request.'}
```

Tested on Arbitrum Sepolia Tenderly env.


_Originally posted by @michalinacienciala  in https://github.com/tahowallet/dapp/issues/363_

issue.title: Proxy Wars: More QoL improvements for dApp connections
issue.body: This PR: - Fixes #3612, which stemmed from issues impersonating MetaMask. - Fixes #3604, which stemmed from bad `this` assignment during proxy calls when impersonating MetaMask. - Fixes #3395 with a vestigial `wallet_requestPermissions`/`wallet_getPermissions` implementation. - Likely fixes additional dApp connection issues. Additionally, it introduces logging for MetaMask-impersonated requests that includes timing information and parameter/return value/error value information: This is similar to existing request/response logging in dApps, but it: - Only happens on development builds. - Distinguishes between calls handled by Taho and calls handled by MetaMask or the MetaMask mock (if MetaMask is not installed). - Intercepts all function calls and return values, not just JSON-RPC requests, allowing us to identify diverging behaviors with MM more easily. - Highlights errored calls. - Includes call and return value in one line. - Includes how long the call took to complete. - Only reports the call without the return value if it takes >1s to complete. - Reports long-running calls every second with a note on how long the call has been pending. Latest build: [extension-builds-3613](https://github.com/tahowallet/extension/suites/17640396586/artifacts/1008525478) (as of Thu, 26 Oct 2023 03:02:30 GMT).

comment.body:
> anything needed for this? testing?

Testing, yes! Hoping to ship this fella next week.

commits.message:
Add vestigial wallet_requestPermissions support

wallet_requestPermissions is defined by EIP-2255, but does not seem to
have much use outside of an alternative to `eth_accounts` and a way to
re-prompt the user for access to more/different accounts.

For the time being, `wallet_requestPermissions` is implemented exactly
like `eth_requestAccounts`, and `wallet_getPermissions` exactly like
`eth_accounts`, except that the return value is structured somewhat
differently.

If and when Taho supports connecting multiple accounts to the same dApp
simultaneously, we can extend this model with two things:

- Always prompting the user to update their connected accounts when
  `wallet_requestPermissions` is invoked.
- Returning more than one account in the `wallet_getPermissions`
  `restrictedReturnedAccounts` caveat.

commits.message:
Assert URL of the scan website opened for unverified assets

We're adding steps to the `assertVerifyAssetPopup` function which open the scan
website, check its URL and close the scan website.
Show different private key import errors
Attempt private key import to validate input

Handle invalid responses on batch rpc providers

Fixes an issue with some RPCs returning invalid responses for batch requests,
such as receiving a single error object for a batch of rpc requests when
`eth_call` fails.

v0.48.0 (#3610)

## What's Changed
* Create E2E tests for verified/unverified tokens by @michalinacienciala
in https://github.com/tahowallet/extension/pull/3472
* v0.47.0 by @Shadowfiend in
https://github.com/tahowallet/extension/pull/3601
* Versions that go bump in the night: Bump versions across a few
different core dependencies by @Shadowfiend in
https://github.com/tahowallet/extension/pull/3415


**Full Changelog**:
https://github.com/tahowallet/extension/compare/v0.47.0...v0.48.0

Latest build:
[extension-builds-3610](https://github.com/tahowallet/extension/suites/15695499704/artifacts/896067135)
(as of Thu, 31 Aug 2023 16:31:16 GMT).
Merge branch 'main' into pk-errors-improvements

Attempt to import private key to validate it (#3614)

Ref https://github.com/tahowallet/extension/issues/3608

### What

Let's validate private key by trying to import it

Latest build:
[extension-builds-3614](https://github.com/tahowallet/extension/suites/15728481611/artifacts/898042290)
(as of Fri, 01 Sep 2023 13:37:44 GMT).

Group private keys when categorizing

When the signer id abstraction was introduced, I misunderstood each
private key as needing to be treated as its own signer. In fact, we
treat, on the UI side, all private keys as a single signer group. To
fix this, rather than return the wallet id for the signer in these
cases, we just return the constant string `"private-key"`. This ensures
all private keys are categorized together.

Group private keys when categorizing (#3618) When the signer id abstraction was introduced, I misunderstood each private key as needing to be treated as its own signer. In fact, we treat, on the UI side, all private keys as a single signer group. To fix this, rather than return the wallet id for the signer in these cases, we just return the constant string `"private-key"`. This ensures all private keys are categorized together. ## Testing - [x] Import 2 or more private keys. Observe that they are under one category in the account list (see below). On the previous release version, they should be listed as distinct categories. For simplicity, you can use `0c1cd323ff8fd5b34f260d580c3a843f3e06c3e1e31c357d38a4a22e8b26809b` (used for testing 0-leading private key imports) and `1c1cd323ff8fd5b34f260d580c3a843f3e06c3e1e31c357d38a4a22e8b26809b` (swaps the 0 to a 1 in the previous key) as private keys. Fixes #3606. Latest build: [extension-builds-3618](https://github.com/tahowallet/extension/suites/15767975455/artifacts/899975852) (as of Sun, 03 Sep 2023 04:04:18 GMT).
Merge remote-tracking branch 'origin/main' into verify-scan-website
Merge branch 'main' into verify-scan-website
Assert URL of the scan website opened for unverified assets (#3602)
Merge branch 'main' into bad-response

Move vault migration tracking into AnalyticsService

AnalyticsService should act as an event sink and manage events
internally to the extent possible. In particular, InternalSignerService
no longer depends on AnalyticsService, but rather vice versa. This sets
the stage for also tracking signing events centrally in
AnalyticsService.

Track data signature events and failures when analytics are enabled

Nothing is recorded about the signature other than the fact that data
was signed. Failures track error reason, which is a very limited set of
possible errors managed by the `SigningService`.

Notably, this commit also moves handling for transaction signatures out
of `Main` and into `AnalyticsService`, which should be loosely coupled
to service events when possible.
Handle invalid responses on batch rpc providers (#3615)
Merge branch 'main' into joint-privacy

Joint Privacy: Rework analytics service event management and add signing tracking (#3623)

This PR does two core things:
- Moves responsibility for more event tracking into the AnalyticsService
itself.
- Adds tracking events for when data is signed and when there is an
error signing data or transactions. The data signed and signature are
not sent to Posthog, and in the case of errors only a generic set of
errors is sent (rather than full error data).

Note that there is still a lot of unnecessary event management happening
in `Main`, which should just be event observations from
`AnalyticsService`. These can be handled at a later time.

Latest build:
[extension-builds-3623](https://github.com/tahowallet/extension/suites/15873783826/artifacts/905833489)
(as of Wed, 06 Sep 2023 10:24:01 GMT).

Will think about the best way to tie these together.

issue.title: infinite loop on guild.xyz only when Taho as default is selected
issue.body:
### Discord Discussion Link

_No response_

### What browsers are you seeing the problem on?

Chrome

### What were you trying to do?

Trying to use guild.xyz with Taho after having logged in to the same page on another browser/machine with the same account.

This is something I've been encountering recently but could not find the cause of. (did not happen often)

During testing I finally found a way to force the issue to happen.

Note: Taho is the _only_ wallet installed during this issue

### What did not work?

When Taho is the default (despite being the only wallet installed) some looping issue is encountered.

Setting to not be default resolves the issue.

* connect to https://guild.xyz/ with Taho while the Taho as default is enabled, sign the login message
* in a different browser or machine connect to https://guild.xyz/ with the same wallet address, sign the login message
* on the first browser/machine refresh the page
* it should indicate that you need to log in again and then pop up the wallet selection, which may appear to flicker
* the browser console will be flooded with messages if the issue occurs and you will _not_ get a popup from the wallet to sign the login message
* open the extension and toggle the default at the top of the UI to not be Taho
* the looping should stop, but you must then refresh the page to have things work again
* you should now be presented with the login prompt ("Verify account")

### Version

v0.47.0

### Relevant log output

_No response_

comment.body: I had a semi-fix here that I haven't had a chance to finish. Might see if I can dust it off and ship a fix next week.

issue.title: Can't go back (`<`) after extension window hides and is opened back

labels.name: Priority: Medium
labels.description: Medium monetary / growth impact, long time frame for completion

issue.body:
1. Go to Chain dropdown  > `Add network (beta)` > `Add chains with Chainlist`. Chainlist opens in a new tab
2. Make the extension window hide (either by clicking somewhere in the browser outside of the extension or clicking `Add chains with Chainlist`).
3. Open the extension again. The `Add network (beta)` view is still there (OK).
4. Click the back button (`<`). The same `Custom networks (beta)` view gets loaded.

Same problem occurs in `Add custom asset` view. And sometimes both views get mixed (clicking `<` on `Add custom asset` navigates to `Add network (beta)`.

https://www.awesomescreenshot.com/video/17105297?key=21ffaa8ee3761717e6f5bef02b605ffe

Tested on: [extension-builds-3361](https://github.com/tahowallet/extension/suites/12651203301/artifacts/677889151) (as of Wed, 03 May 2023 16:05:22 GMT).

comment.body:
I didn't see how it could be fixed, glad to know I'm not crazy :zany_face: 

I'll keep an eye out for this one in future testing

issue.body:
### Discord Discussion Link

_No response_

### What browsers are you seeing the problem on?

Chrome

### What were you trying to do?

Trying to use guild.xyz with Taho after having logged in to the same page on another browser/machine with the same account.

This is something I've been encountering recently but could not find the cause of. (did not happen often)

During testing I finally found a way to force the issue to happen.

Note: Taho is the _only_ wallet installed during this issue

### What did not work?

When Taho is the default (despite being the only wallet installed) some looping issue is encountered.

Setting to not be default resolves the issue.

* connect to https://guild.xyz/ with Taho while the Taho as default is enabled, sign the login message
* in a different browser or machine connect to https://guild.xyz/ with the same wallet address, sign the login message
* on the first browser/machine refresh the page
* it should indicate that you need to log in again and then pop up the wallet selection, which may appear to flicker
* the browser console will be flooded with messages if the issue occurs and you will _not_ get a popup from the wallet to sign the login message
* open the extension and toggle the default at the top of the UI to not be Taho
* the looping should stop, but you must then refresh the page to have things work again
* you should now be presented with the login prompt ("Verify account")

### Version

v0.47.0

### Relevant log output

_No response_

comment.body:
Any chance this can be addressed soon? I know yall have been busy with other amazing things, but this is a pain point that new users are very likely to encounter.

Confirmed still present in v0.50.0 if Taho as default is enabled

issue.title: Can't sign GALXE transactions on Ledger on Optimism

labels.name: Priority: Medium
labels.description: Medium monetary / growth impact, long time frame for completion

issue.body: ### Discord Discussion Link https://discord.com/channels/808358975287722045/888500174685614090/1023491062926417950 ### What browsers are you seeing the problem on? Chrome ### What were you trying to do? Sign a signature message through the Ledger ### What did not work? To reproduce: - Connect to Galxe with a ledger address - Set the network in the Extension to Optimism (I believe Polygon has the same behavior) - Set the network on Galxe to Optimism (not in the position to test right now, not 100% if this is needed) - Go to Galxe ID, profile - Select 'Edit' - It will require you to sign a message. The initial screen comes up in Tally Ho, the Ledger sign screen in Tally Ho briefly flashes, but then jumps back - There is no action on the Ledger ### Version v0.16.2 ### Relevant log output _No response_

comment.body:
Would it be possible to implement some workaround until a complete fix can be delivered?

This issue can be a big pain if the dapp doesn't have a network selector since the wallet 'remembers' what network was used on the dapp connection.

Even if the user:
* disconnects with the lightning bolt button in the wallet
* clears browser cache
* restarts browser
* changes network in wallet to Ethereum
* connects to the dapp again

the wallet still uses the wrong network since it pulls it from storage. (_Major_ UX showstopper here)

For the first time, this actually did _not_ happen to me when testing fresh v0.50.0
Resolved?
